isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing service bay diagnostics on engine or vehicle.

svcproc.title: Starting Master Diagnostics From The Windows Desktop

step1.para: Connect the EST or laptop computer to the EZ-Tech Interface. (See Tools and Accessories.)

note.para: If the EZ-Tech Interface is not available, the previous International® Truck Interface cable and ATA 9-pin to 6-pin adapter can be used.

step1.para: Boot up the EST or laptop computer with Master Diagnostics software.
Double click on the desktop icon (Vehicle Diagnostics).

The Vehicle Diagnostics window will be displayed. Depending on the vehicle, Master Diagnostics can be opened for engines using a 3 box engine controller, for those that use the single box Diamond Logic™ controller (DLC) or for those that use the 2 box Diamond Logic Control (DLCII).

svcproc.para: After starting the Master Diagnostics software, the computer should display the main window .
There is a menu bar just below the window's title bar. All available software features can be accessed by these drop-down menus .
The tool bar menu provides quick and easy access to features of this software.

item.para: File→ Open: Opens a graphical or text display file, snapshot setup (*.trg), or programmable parameter display file (*.ppv). This option allows the user to recall and view previously saved configurations. Three display formats are available: *.ntv (a text display for International engines), *.jtv (a text display for generic J1587 ATA data link engines), *.pgv (a graphical display).
File→ Save: Saves the configuration of the highlighted window.
File→ Save As: Saves the configuration of the highlighted window and prompts the user for a file name.
File→ Print: Prints the highlighted window to the printer or a file. Not all windows may be printed.
File→ New: Opens a new graphical display window.
File→ New: Opens a new International® text display window.
File→ New: Opens a new J1587 ATA text display window.
Edit→ Add/Delete/Edit: Adds, deletes or edits parameters from the highlighted window.
Session→ Open: Retrieves a previously setup Master Diagnostics sessions.
COM→ Open: Begins the ATA communications via the EST COM port.
Sniffer→ Open: Opens and displays all active Message ID (MID) addresses on the ATA datalink. This provides a quick view of available electronic modules.
Snapshot→ Setup: Sets up the snapshot recording options: the trigger source, pre-trigger recording time, post-trigger recording time, which parameters to record, how often to sample data, etc.
Snapshot→ Arm: Arms the trigger for the snapshot.
Snapshot→ Disarm: Disarms the trigger for the snapshot.
Snapshot→ Start: Manually starts the snapshot recording. The F2 key has the same function.
Snapshot→ Stop: Manually stops the snapshot recording. The F3 key has the same function.
Snapshot→ Replay: Replays a snapshot recording file in a graphical format.
Snapshot→ Replay: Replays a snapshot recording file in a text format.
Vehicle→ View Information→ Basic: Opens the vehicle information window.
Vehicle→ View Information→ Basic +: Opens vehicle information, programming, DTC, and temperature windows.
Vehicle→ Program: Opens an electronic engine controller module programming window.
Code→ View: Opens the trouble code window.
Code→ Clear: Clears the trouble codes contained in the ECM.
Help→ Contents: Opens Master Diagnostics software help.
File→ Exit: Exits and terminates the Master Diagnostics program.
